channel.title: Comments on The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction

item.title: Sam commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Sam
item.description:
Hi guys!

I know this is a long shot, but was going to head down on Saturday and a few of the group I'm with are keen to watch the boxing later on. Is there anywhere which you think would be showing it? Cheers

item.title: Sam commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Sam
item.description: Thanks for the info! I wondered if you knew if any are dog friendly?

item.title: Josh M commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Josh M
item.description: Another one for the list is Pitcher and Craft on Southwark Park Road. Bottle shop stocking a good range and a selection of craft beers on keg to drink in.

item.title: Tom commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Tom
item.description:
Hi, great to have all the info in one place, thank you!
If I was planning to take on the beer mile with a largeish group of friends (maybe 20 people, for a birthday celebration) would we be able to just turn up and pick and choose which bars to go in, or will we need to book?
Thank you!

item.title: Christopher Robertson commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Christopher Robertson
item.description:
Hey! Just a small update from Cloudwater, we are open inside again now for table service only, Wednesday through to Sunday. From the 1st of Novemeber our opening hours will be:
Monday/Tuesday: Closed
Wednesday/Thursday: 16:00 - 21:00
Friday: 16:00 - 22:00
Saturday: 12:00 - 22:00
Sunday: 12:00 - 20:00

item.title: Nathan commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Nathan
item.description: Is it safe to assume that on Saturday the 24th of July, the first weekend since all restrictions being eased, all venues will no longer need bookings?

item.title: Huw commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Huw
item.description: Just called them and they're showing the footy and managed to book a table! Thanks for your help!

item.title: SpankTM commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: SpankTM
item.description: Huw - That's a tricky one at the moment - most of the bars are largely operating on the street, with not much going on in the indoor space where you'd normally keep a telly. Based on our trip there last weekend, the only one we saw that had the football on was Craft Beer Junction. (You can see it in the picture on https://www.bermondsey-beer-mile.co.uk/craft-beer-junction.html if you squint really hard.)

item.title: Huw commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Huw
item.description: Hi, me and some of my friends were planning on visiting the beer mile in the coming weeks, does anyone know if any of the spots will have a TV that can show the football?

item.title: Claire commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Claire
item.description: And Partizan was closed and locked up yesterday and there were no chairs and tables set up outside, so I don’t know if it was a one off thing or if the taproom hasn’t reopened yet....

item.title: Claire commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Claire
item.description: Affinity has been replaced by The Outpost Brewery and Taproom (a Three Hills Brewing Project). They opened the taproom a week ago and they have an interesting beer range (including a peach melba fruited sour) as well as some guest beers.

item.title: Joey commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Joey
item.description: Any idea if this is open at the moment?

item.title: James commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: James
item.description:
Hey, great guide.

So I've tentatively started organising my brothers stag do and thought the beer mile would be a fun thing to do on it. However after the crap year we've all had im wondering if you've heard any news about when/if theyre all reopening.

The stag do wouldnt be until July so there's plenty of time so fingers crossed. Just wondered if you'd heard any news.

James

item.title: Chris commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description: One to add to the list would be No Boring Beer on Tower Bridge Road: https://no-boring-beer.com/

item.title: Amy Nightingale commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Amy Nightingale
item.description: Hi, does anyone know if the mile is starting to open up again with restrictions easing??

item.title: Dave M commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Dave M
item.description: Hop Kingdom is another small bar with its own skate park at 16 Druid Street. Only 2 beers and very much geared towards the skaters, no onsite brewery but a nice little bar.

item.title: Felipe commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Felipe
item.description: HI. Thanks for the info. I couldn't find a map so I created one with all the sites that you have here, feel free to use it (https://drive.google.com/open?id=1_r59dPFklcoM7enogO-g4bUzYaGdtRDE&usp=sharing).

item.title: Johnnybeerboy commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Johnnybeerboy
item.description: How long would you recommend allotting to do the mile? And what time would you recommend starting? I know these are subjective but let’s say at an average pace, what time start/how long to take do you think?

item.title: Bethany Sinclair commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Bethany Sinclair
item.description:
Super useful guide, I was wondering how many of the locations are wheelchair accessible?
Thanks :)

item.title: Bermondsey Lido commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Bermondsey Lido
item.description:
You forgot the small beer Brewing company in verney road.

I live near Enid St, just off Spa Road. I think the arches are nice and glad to see breweries there.

item.title: Cllr Humaira Ali commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Cllr Humaira Ali
item.description:
I'm a local Councillor and whilst it's fantastic to have loads of businesses in the area, the creation of the 'beer mile' has given untold stress to local residents. There is increased noise, antisocial behaviour, danger for young children and a broad cumulative impact from some loud and leery revellers. We are working with businesses and the first order will be to rename it away from the beer mile. Whoever is visiting the area, please show the utmost consideration to residents and keep noise to a minimum. You wouldn't want to experience what my residents have to ensure. Residents with PTSD, sensory disorders are now under greater medical supervision.

To those that run this site. Nice idea and helpful but I'd respectfully ask you to rename away from the beer mile. Happy to work with you when this area is rebranded.

item.title: SpankTM commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: SpankTM
item.description: Kat - Full maps of the Mile do exist out there - like this one https://www.google.com/maps/d/embed?mid=1qOln6LfuHW_qZWVVvWzA6-rYlHQ&ll=51.498415722518835%2C-0.07049506088253565&z=16 - but our thinking was that it's far too big and rapidly-changing nowadays for a single map to cover it sensibly. That's why we've chosen to plot a series of individual maps between one bar and the next - click on the distance figures above to pull those up.

item.title: Kat commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Kat
item.description: Would there be a map of this somewhere?

item.title: Warren commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: Warren
item.description: Cheers thanks for your reply chum

item.title: SpankTM commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'
item.dc:creator: SpankTM
item.description: Warren - My guess would be that most of them will be closed - a lot of them don't open on Mondays anyway, and it wouldn't make much difference whether it was a Bank Holiday or not. Bear in mind a lot of these places are working breweries first, bars second, and they like to take holidays too! Still, each bar is a separate case and will have their own plans. Probably best to check their individual websites and associated social media feeds and see what their plans are.
